messages.message:
Hey everyone — I’ll be working with a few folks to develop some curriculum that guides an engineer from foundational Python skills at Instabase to advanced topics. See this doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gev72qg1VVdpjOQzlV_J6Bke7VvM570mnVecE-GLivg/edit?folder=1tuDu6TfwGxc2Vi2alG4w6ufqdfIFdPPe#

We’re going to be making interactive code examples and videos for various topics. What I ask of you:

1. Can you identify topics not listed under “Guides” that you’d like to see? If so, please add it to the doc
2. Do you want to contribute material in the form of videos or code examples? Please reach out!
3. Can you think of other ways we can help engineers onboard to this material besides videos and code walkthroughs?
cc: @Jonathan Shih @shaunak who expressed early interest in creating this material.
cc: @Aaron Vontell @lydia @Aaron Tami + others who likely will want to create such topics for your particular area of expertise
cc: @achao @Kerry @Felicia @abhilash @arun who might have topics they’d like to request for Python learnings
Thank you for leading the effort for this @dlluncor. This is high leverage stuff :wink: . I ll add a few things. Excited for this.

Thanks @dlluncor! In general, it's hard to tell what I do not know :slightly_smiling_face:

But, information (or vetted pointers) on typing with mypy would be useful too, especially differences with other typed languages like Java, in their expressiveness, if they do runtime checking etc.
sounds good Mohit and Abhilash — I’ll make sure we cover that content!
super looking forward to this, thanks for creating!
